results.title: Teaching nutrition: cross age tutoring
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: A short program for teachers to view before they become involved in nutrition education. It uses the cross age tutoring approach but the message is equally important regardless of the teaching strategies to be used. For both primary and secondary teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit

results.title: Adventure Games in the Classroom
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Outlines how to integrate the computer into the classroom by using an adventure games approach. The emphasis is on situations where only one computer per class is available.

results.title: Having a say: Helene
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Helen came to Australia from France and found difficulty in fitting in. Language was a basic factor in her problem, but through English in the Workplace, her life changed as did her work satisfaction level.

results.title: Building an education partnership through the School Community Development Program
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: A program designed to inform parents, teachers and community groups about the aims and objectves of the School Community Development Program. Highlights three case studies at Fitzroy, Ballarat and West Heidelberg.

results.title: Having a say
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: The English in the Workplace Scheme is designed to help non-English speaking unionists to take their place in Australian society. This program outlines the problems and the responses to the scheme.

results.title: Here's to your health: skincare
results.creator_credit: Craig Reardon, Robert Grant and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: Australia has the highest rate of skin cancer in the world. This program looks at the problem of skin cancer, how to detect it and how to care for your skin when out in the sun.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Craig Reardon, Robert Grant and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit

results.title: Max Stephens talks about frameworks
results.brief_description: Max Stephens addresses a meeting at Horsham in June 1987 to explain the stage of development that the Curriculum frameworks project had then reached. The program outlines the basis and approach to learning emphasised by the Frameworks project and also looks at the implementation of tasks. No other credits available.

results.title: Preparing your child for school. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Part 1. Discussion is centered on helping children handle being separated from their parents, relating to other children and adults, gaining independence and responsibility in new situations and encouraging curiosity and confidence. Part 2. Encompasses a number of practical considerations which parents will find helpful in preparing their child for school, such as clothing, lunches and school bags.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group

results.title: What we do at kindergarten
results.creator_credit: Dianne Milwright, Donn Clauscen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: Shows daily activities in kindergartens emphasising the extent activities aid the preschool child’s development. Suitable for use with parents of kindergarten age children and for infant primary teachers as a background knowledge of what happens in kindergartens.
